intro: Hieracium brachiatum subsp. brachiatiforme, commonly known as the broad-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its rosette of broad, spoon-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow composite flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. It typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
